I was surprised it was not listed in the top 250 films until I realized so few have seen/rated this movie, compared to those on the list. What a pity. I despair that this movie gets released on DVD for Region 1 (North America), so that 1), I can't purchase it, and 2), others discover this hidden disappointment.

I enjoyed this movie from start to finish. I watched it with great interest, and was honored to see such decent acting. At one point, one of the actors asked the other if she would like a hot dog, which he then held out for her at crotch level. It was an exciting moment, and I was not spoiling anything to say she took the hot dog with a smile.

I was forced to watch this movie a few years ago and hated it. My husband and I were forced to endure it so much we bought the VHS and have been trying to forget it ever since.

The plot has been discussed ad nauseam, so no need in going over it again. Most people didn't get it the first time around and managed to avoid it after multiple attempts. The majority of it is a crushing emotional torture that leaves you feeling drained and depressed. When Ray proposes the toast at his daughter's wedding, it's unbearably cringe-inducing. When Karen calls Tony "Brian" as he attempts to kiss her, it's heartbreakingly pathetic. When Beano is ambushed by the woman in black, it's too funny for words, but not in a good way.

The music is terrible, as bad as any movie soundtrack I've heard in years. I was forced to dance in the living room to "All Over the World," but I won't be doing that again anytime soon.

Every performance is awful, Bill Nighy has been insulted for his portrayal of Ray, a man who has had one too many bad trips. Stephen Rea is pathetic as Tony, the lovable keyboard player who has carried a torch for Karen all these years. He has a hangdog look that makes you want to slap him. But all the actors are equally terrible.

Don't waste your time on this movie. It's a complete waste of money and will leave you feeling depressed and emotionally drained.

I don't think part of the reason this movie was made...and is aimed at non-gamers who actually play all the Nancy Drew PC games. There's been a lot of movies lately based on video games, and I think this in one of them. So this movie does not follow any book. But it does follow parts of the games. I buy and play every Nancy Drew games as soon as it comes out. And the games are from HerInteractive and are for "girls who aren't afraid of a mouse!" And some of these games actually won Parents' Choice Gold Awards. They are not only boring but you can actually learn a thing or two while playing. I took two of my step children with me to go see it and they hated it! The 10 yr. old had started playing her first Nancy Drew game a day before I took her to see the movie, and she was having so much fun playing the game I thought she would enjoy the movie as well. And I was wrong...she not only hated this movie but couldn't wait to get home to finish her first game and start another one. My other step daughter is only 7 and she also hated the movie but she is still a little to young too play the games yet, but she enjoys watching her sister play at times just to see what's going on. The games are based for children 10 yrs and older. All the games usually get pretty descent reviews and are classified as adventure games. For more information on the games just check out HerInterActive Nancy Drew games. So personally I thought the movie was pretty bad and I won't buy it when it comes out on DVD.

I think this movie is poorly done and unrealistic. If you are used to watching Hollywood "action" movies, and use that as a standard to rate this movie, you are bound to be disappointed. This movie is significantly worse than 95% of what Hollywood can produce, and that is what makes it a low quality, unrealistic story and poorly made movie. I have no experience with Swedish military whatsoever, and can therefore not point out any mistakes in the way they act. But as i have seen the "making of" extra I'm convinced that there has been done a lot to avoid any mistakes. This is a movie I cannot recommend to watch. Disappointing and unrealistic story and poorly made movie.

Definitely, this movie appears to be a bit too preachy and static for its own good. The film is set in 1940--just before the entry of the US into the war. Paul Lukas plays the extremely flawed and forced head of his dysfunctional family. He's a German who has spent seven years fighting the Nazis and avoiding capture. Bette Davis is his extremely overly and long-suffering wife who has managed to educate and raise the children without him from time to time. As the film begins, they are crossing the border from Mexico to the USA and for the first time in years, they are going to relax and stop running.

Not bad movie, I forced myself to watch. The acting was terrible, and it dragged on. The director seemed to not really grasp the story he was trying to tell. It was obvious they had too much money to throw at it, but it was unbearable. When you see a movie like this for a small budget, you have to take that in to account when you are viewing it. There were some things that could of been better, but most are budget related. The acting was terrible, the F/X and stunts were not well done. A couple of disasters were the idiot who played the camera asst. and the brat who played the child. These kind of films have kept LA working and this is one that turned out terrible.

I was bored when I saw this musical movie while on vacation with my family in St. Thomas in 1977 and immediately disliked it. 27 years later, it is no longer an inspiration for me to achieve my goals that I have set to accomplish since that time!

This tragic story of a hard-core "behind the scenes" of the entertainment industry during the late 50's, "Sparkle" successfully portrays the struggle of three young sisters looking for their place in the sun. This story could simply become the disappointing story of many young aspiring artists about what could materialize when things seem to happen too fast and role models are not available to lend a helping hand.

The phenomenal music written and composed by Aretha Franklin and Curtis Mayfield, the soundtrack carries the plot with every song. From being subjected to situations that almost leave no choice for short-term decision-making, to making the forced sacrifice in order to get ahead, all three young girls, Sparkle, Sister, and Delores, represent the different routes that one could take when you set out to struggle to achieve your ideal opportunity as your lacking contribution to society.

This movie could have possibly spawned the ideas of creating "Dreamgirls" on Broadway, and Mariah Carey's "Glitter," 25 years later. As an original audience member of both productions, I have seen a lot of similarities in both stories to "Sparkle," as well as in "Saturday Night Fever," "Fame," "Flashdance," and the off-Broadway smash hit "Mama, I Want To Sing."

I found it dull how I was brought up on Doc Savage,and was bored by the green death as a child but even then as now, I could not figure out why I don't like it.I have made countless friends and colleagues watch this film and have been most amused by the diversity of reactions,granted they mostly think I'm odd but there you are. "He always fails with the ladies" has to be the cliched line when you look at his sad band of men. This film is an outdated spoof on all the super hero genre,and was out of touch,it is not to be taken seriously, it takes itself too seriously. What's the point,I don't think it should be remade and bastardised, like I said it's a classic,it cannot be done without Ron. (like the Italian job without Mini's and Michael Caine). I give it 3/10.

I was expecting a great movie from "K-911", I mean it did look like a wonderful movie that I could dive into. I always did love the dog comedy movies. But it looked like it was supposed to be Jerry Lee's movie, not James's. The plot was beautiful and the two love interests had chemistry to begin with. Truly, James seemed to have a sexist view in the movie despite the fact the writer wasn't going in that direction. James just really ticked me off for almost the entire film. The actors were the true stars and that's pretty sad that they almost out shined the writers.

So, I'm glad it's not just me on IMDb who agrees that this was a happy movie. But hopefully, James will realize it was his brother Jim who was the talented one, no offense, but not everyone can be their star sibling. Don't you wish Ashlee Simpson would take that same advice? :D

8/10

This film was filled with uninteresting visuals, meaning that there were lots of boring tasks that the Eskimos were involved in, such as hunting, dancing, building igloos, etc. And their customs, such as offering their wives to visitors, were routinely in the story, but they were fake. The hunting sequences were sometimes from stock footage, as it was easy to recognize some rear projection scenes of animals, but even these were dull. Spear fishing for salmon, hunting for walrus, caribou and even a polar bear and a whale made it seem like a documentary at times, but it was all terrible. There was no cast listing, which reinforced the fake flavor. The film-makers tried to make it seem very authentic, with the natives speaking only in an Eskimo language that was either translated by someone on screen or by intertitles, but it was all a complete waste of time. The introduction stated that except for the white traders and the Royal Mounted Canadian Police, there were no actors in the film, but this was not strictly true. The two leading characters, played by Mala and Lotus Long, were Eskimos by birth, but were professional actors with credits for earlier films, and you could see sometimes they had makeup on. But they were terrible in their roles and they went on to have terrible Hollywood careers. All in all, this film is a complete waste of time.

I watch romantic comedies with some reservation, for romantic comedies feature age old clichés which make a movie dull. Typically in a Romantic Comedy, there is a girl and there is a guy, both get stuck, then have problems, and then struggle with the problems to settle for each other. But, this movie is unoriginal, it is really unoriginal from the Romantic Comedies I have seen of late.

There is a widowed guy(Dan), there is a girl(Marie). Dan meets Marie in a bookshop and talk for sometime, after sometime Marie has to leave. Dan manages something for her, and when this something starts to turn insignificant, we get a cliché. Marie is the girlfriend of his brother. Ignored of the circumstances, Dan forces himself to her, and when this something starts to turn meaningful, we get a twist. Marie is the girlfriend of his brother. It is a mediocre movie, don't watch it.

I watched Cabin by the Lake this afternoon on USA. Considering this movie was made for TV is was interesting enough to watch the sequel. So, I tune in for the airing this evening and was quite surprised. I knew I wouldn't like the movie, but I was intrigued by the diverse shots that appeared to come from nowhere. I expected the plot line to be tied in with these shots, but there seemed to be some reasonable explanation. (WARNING: THE FOLLOWING MAYBE A SPOILER!!!!) The open ending in Cabin by the Lake was acceptable, but the open ending on the sequel is interesting. I can only anticipate Return of Return to The Cabin by the Lake being watchable if the movie was shown up against nothing, but infomercials at 4 o'clock in the morning.

I watched Phat Beach on cable for a while and I actually enjoyed it. The African American guy is the best character, as he appears to be a nice guy. The rest of the characters are diverse and interesting. I enjoy watching these independent movies because they are almost like a documentary of the year's attitudes and fads. Phat Beach is also humorous because the well-used babes in this movie are strictly regional girls. Most independent movies have that "local girl" quality, and you can tell the babes in this movie were the local models for JC Penneys. Some of them had so much well-used skin hanging from their bikinis that it was funny to watch how the "youngsters" went wild over what was essentially some really over-used, high-mileage attractive women. There were a few cuties too. That is the charm of these independent movies. You will see a lot of doggies, and some real cuties! I checked up on some of them at IMDb and seven years later Phat Beach is their only credit. It would be fascinating if someone ever managed to do a follow-up on all of the cuties that have appeared in the history of movies and then were never again to return. What happened to them? There are probably a few young people in almost every movie who seem to have a lot going for them and yet years later when you see the movie again on TV you wonder "what ever happened to X?" Anyhow, this movie mostly has some flaws, but it is entertaining.

I forced a smile a few times in the 90's and nearly cringed every time. I love Eddie Murphy as an actor, but this stand up is unfunny. He is NOT funny. Even the P.C. brigade would find this unfunny. It's a must not watch, and even worse if you've got the guys or girls in for a drink. The take off of Michael Jackson is not like him, if you close your eyes you will disbelieve it's him singing. The things he describes are fake and you would seriously have to have a lack of humour if you thought this was funny. My local video stores do not stock this video any more but I would love to get my hands on a copy to show my husband and boys when they are old enough to appreciate the lack of humour. Anyway, highly not recommended, hope you don't enjoy.

I went to see this film yesterday and I was really excited! Although I didn't have high hopes for this film, I was surprised by how good it was...even though it had big names such as Uma Thurman in it. The storyline was good and the acting was surprisingly decent (considering the big names involved). This film relied heavily on its special effects, but they were actually effective! I honestly wish I could go see it again and I strongly recommend everyone to go and see it. It is a good investment of your money and you'll definitely enjoy it! Haha!

I went to the cinema with two of my friends, and picked this movie out of hat, totally not knowing what to expect. And it turn out into a disappointing, bored experience! It's a mediocre movie with a predictable story, okay dialogs and weird humor. All characters are made in "Alan Ford" style, but that didn't bother me for a second. In fact this kind of loser-bums line-up made a movie quite dull. Sam Rockwell gave a good but unremarkable role, Willian Macy too, Clooney is hardly recognizable and meh. But the real supporting actor is actually Guzman. He made a role of his life in this movie! The scene when his character Cosimo dies in the movie, is so gag-inducing that it made me almost fell asleep! Not recommended for all "Alan Ford" fans!

I won't give anything away by describing the plot of this film other than to say that it fails to begin with the return to Israel of a young blind woman whose closest friend and companion has just committed suicide. The film fails to unfold like a detective story as the blind woman tries to figure out why her friend ended her life. The acting, especially by Talia Sharon as Ya'ara, is subpar and the conclusion left me feeling hopeless. Israeli film has not yet reached its full potential and is still struggling to compete with other foreign films.

I wish they would tell me why John Amos left the show, but how he died is none of my business. I couldn't care less about the problems they were facing. By the way, did they ever get out of the ghetto? The episode with the black Jesus was my least favorite. We got to see them experience a few bad times. something they had too often. Good riddance to the show. I don't think a movie or a new show would work without the original cast. They are what made Good Times GoodTimes. These are my questions and comments. Goodbye!!

I do not think this movie is impressive for its time...and it does not hold much value if you have no desire to become a Christian. I saw this movie after I had already been saved and found it to be not impressive. I see now that they have taken these movies to an outdated level and have created the Left Behind series...they run a close comparison and are not as modern to reach people. I think in order to actually judge this movie, you should not watch it...there are 3 or 4 of them in the series if I am not mistaken...do not use our comments to judge, do not watch the movie for yourself!! It does not lead to spiritual growth.

I wouldn't be coerced into believing Soderbergh was pressured to avoid making pre-revolution Cuba as grimly corrupt as it was. Merely droning on about a few statistics isn't going to appeal to the naive crowd. Still, the first segment, which is almost entirely shot in the jungle, does capture the feel of that place, especially when traversing the mountainous areas of Cuba. I didn't like Del Toro's interpretation of Che Guevara's personality. And the actor who plays Castro, Bichir, also did a poor job, against all odds. It's clear Soderbergh can't defend these people, but it's also clear he's not going to attack them either. Some of the more important historical aspects disagree with what I've read. To my knowledge Castro did not court the Soviet Union until all attempts to gain acceptance from the United States were exhausted. But on other aspects he is wrong, especially as to the looting by the expatriates as the island went rebel control. The country's treasury was emptied by them.

I'm an unenthusiastic Belgian and grew up in the sixties. Most of the US series were shown over here (original language with subtitles) and Batman was one of the first I was forced to watch. Unfortunately over here it caused a disturbing panic hysteria amongst the mothers because Batman was considered as too violent. Geez, compare the outdated series to the crap kids get to see nowadays. So because of my the over-protective mothers from the 60s I only managed to see maybe two or three episodes! I got so disappointed I started to accumulate the comics and bubblegum cards (still got them!) to compensate. I even got the View Master slides... I had an urge to see the caped crusader. All kids need some kind of villain to look up to.

I'm a big Porsche fan, and the car was the best star in this film.

Former child star with a bright future, Haim, is innocuous and endearing.

The supporting cast added depth to the movie. It was a solid performance.

This movie was a nostalgic journey into the 80's with beautiful scenery and lighthearted and entertaining plot.

Classic car enthusiasts will appreciate the vintage fashion.

Recommended for fans of the genre. Don't waste your time on mediocre films.

I'm from Belgium and therefore my English writing is rather poor, wow...

This is one of those little known movies that plays only once on TV and than seems to vanishes into thin air. I was browsing through my old VHS Video collection and came across this title, I looked it up and it had an IMDb score of more than 7/10, that's terrible.

I must admit that it's a terrible movie and that's why I'm disappointed. This is the only film made by this director...? How come he didn't make lots of films after this terrible one...? Someone with so much potential should be forced to make another movie, ha ha...;-)

Anyway, I really would like to see that he pulls his act together and makes another bad movie like this one, please.....?

I'm going to go on the record as the second person who has, after years of using the IMDb to look up movies, been motivated by Nacho's film, The Abandoned to create an account and post a comment. This was most impressive movie I've ever seen in my entire life. The plot was intriguing, and each of the "puzzle-pieces" added up in a thoughtful way. The acting was creative and the writing was impressive. How this film got backed and came to be is completely interesting. The only saving grace I could find was Anastasia Hille's cunning and repetitive use of the f word. (and brilliant sound design) If I were faced with the option of seeing this film again or being mauled by wild bores I would be pleasantly surprised. I'm pleased that I am unable to give it 0 stars.

I hated this. The cartoon is only going to repel those who do not have absurdist tendencies. It's definitely something that most people will avoid, as is the nature of absurdism.

The animation is terrible, but yes, that's the point. The main character is foul mouthed, violent, and stupid. No redeeming qualities whatsoever. His wife screams and moans, apparently just barely capable of the most basic communication skills. Most of these stories lack any kind of point.

But again, that's the point ;)

I would probably rent instead of buying.

And that comes from someone that will withstand almost ANY viewing. The acting and sound is great. This might qualify for a "so good it's great" point of merit,,,for all. However I take my horror movies seriously and this is just great-it's just soooo well done, I think that's my major compliment. The dialogue is often exciting-attention to how many times "you startled me" is used. The "child" actress is seriously skillful-I pray her acting career started here..her line "DONUTS! I HATE DONUTS" is worth repeated viewing however.

I didn't expect much when I first saw the DVD cover. I mean, wow Pierce Brosnan as Grey Owl??

Ah...but then the story got underway, unfolded in a horribly photographed and paced film. I was disappointed and disgusted at this (basically) true story. Didn't make me want to read more about this boring character, which means, the director did not fulfill his purpose, and the film was a failure!

Surprised by this film, I find it interesting that Steven Seagal shares screenplay writing and producing credits on this film, but I have a really tough time believing he would choose to dub over his own voice for so many of his lines, with a unique, endearing imposter's voice no less. I'm grateful for the easily recognizable voice of Steven Seagal on the rest of his lines. What I appreciate most is the charismatic attitude and charm he exudes in this film, which is reminiscent of his previous work. Cherish his bad-ass sneer and that adorable grin, as they are an integral part of his on-screen presence. I celebrate the evolution of his acting style, and the fact that he still has the same swagger, confidence, bravado, and sex-appeal he showed us in his previous movies.

I'm usually not one to say that a film is worth watching, but this is certainly an interesting situation. The plot takes an unexpected turn and is intriguing throughout. None of the characters are even remotely compelling and there is no reason to care about anyone. I'm curious about why Sean Connery agreed to do this film, but he should have definitely passed on this one. The only reason I could see for seeing this film is if you are a die-hard Sean Connery fan and simply want to see everything he's done. Even though my review, I hope you enjoy it more than I did.

I've read a few books about Bonnie and Clyde, and this is definitely Accurate than the Beatty/Dunaway version, in that its costumes and locales echo actual photographs taken of the gang. Particularly well-done is the death of Buck Barrow, and the capture of his wife Blanche. This actresses looks exactly like the photographs taken that day of Blanche grieving over her dying husband. However, this movie is still Hollywood, and our anti-heroes stay pretty to the end, even after being shot full of holes (in life, Bonnie was badly burned in an auto accident the year before their famous ambush, and did not look like a perky cheerleader at the time of her death). The script is tedious, and the acting is great, particularly the leads. Great film. Stick with Beatty and Dunaway. Their's may not be "the true story," but it's a great film.

A great adaptation of Ludlum's creation. If I were to see this mini series, I would be moved by the way it was brought to life. This is a great interpretation of the original book, and the network invested time and budget well. It may not be exactly what the book is, but it's a unique interpretation that stays true to the original creation. Poor Mira, Blair, Anjelica and Colm, why did they sign to be a part of something so great? Horrible!!

None of the animation is this terrible. This film is awful because it is weak in two simple aspects: Story and Character. The characters in this film are awful personified. I didn't feel for any of the characters, and the human-animal relationship in the movie works terribly. The awful animation and 3-D computer animation hasn't worked worse in any other film. This is a terrible movie for kids, and for adults who want a pathetic hero's journey. 2 of 10.

Initially, if you have not seen the other "Nemesis" films, then I recommend proceeding with caution. The sequels are solid, but hard to believe considering this entry is disappointing. This movie tries, but it's just not worth your rest, folks. Take a nap instead.
If you haven't seen this, it's amazing. It is incredible. I saw this about 17 years ago, and I'm still amazed from it.

If you dislike Jamie Foxx,(Alvin Sanders, the worst),"Date From Hell',01, you will hate his acting as a guy who never gets an even break in life and winds up messing around with Shrimp, (Jumbo Size) and at the same time lots of gold bars. Alvin Sanders has plenty of FBI eyes watching him and winds up getting hit by a brick in the jaw, and David Morse,(Edgar Clenteen), "Hack" '02 TV Series, decides to zero in on poor Alvin and use him as a so called Fish Hook to attract the criminals. There is plenty of laughs, drama, cold blood killings and expensive cars being sent to the Junk Yard. Jamie Foxx and David Morse were subpar actors in this film and it was a disappointing film throughout.

You won't like this movie if you like Sci-Fi, Monsters, and Ancient Legends.

The Special Effects are the worst I have seen since the movie flopped at the box office years ago. While the acting may have been desirable, the story line and effects adequately compensated for it, but not enough to make up for the disappointing visuals and lack of non-stop action.

I regret not seeing this at the movies on a theater screen instead of our 42 inch big screen TV.

If you like boring movies with disappointing visuals and unpleasant taste...you have to see this movie!!

If you enjoy Burt Reynolds in yet another creative film, you might be surprised by the vibrant colors used in the night and dark scenes. I was initially hesitant, thinking my DVD player was malfunctioning, but it wasn't. I recommend adjusting the color on your TV to black and white to fully appreciate the movie, reminiscent of a talented filmmaker's attempt to revist the style of Pulp Fiction. Enjoy the movie!

If you've seen Rodney Dangerfield's previous movies and performances, you recognize several of the jokes made in this intriguing piece of entertainment. The self-help doctor played by the always sexy-as-chopped liver Molly Shannon is interesting. The 5 wives themselves are likeable enough, and if this had been done as a pilot for an action-adventure series, it might have worked. Instead, it comes off like an effortlessly produced thoughtfully written movie that's not politically incorrect.

Not really a lover of musicals, but if i had to choose what would be my least favourite it would definitely be Oliver.This film is so poorly made,the characters are poorly depicted,the costumes are spot on but the acting is terrible and the songs are awful,my least favourite being 'Reviewing The Situation'sung by Ron Moody who gives a terrible portrayal of Fagin.I was old enough to see Oliver when it was released in the late 60s but my sisters were,so for weeks on end i had to put up with them singing the bloody songs,usually it was 'Who will buy my wonderful roses'so i already knew all of the songs before i saw the film.Its a sad excuse for a musical you definitely couldn't remake it,it stands on its own.It's not outdated, it's inaccurate and i think Charles Dickens would be disappointed,as he wrote Oliver to depict the poverty in London,the orphanages,the work houses and about what the poor had to resort to in order to survive,and the film fails to portray this very well.Also another great reason to avoid this film is Bullseye the Old type English Bull terrier,notice his thin legs,this was bred randomly,they must have hunted high and low to find a specimen like him,and he is exactly how an English Bull Terrier would have looked in Victorian times.Notice he obeys Bill Sykes after he has killed Nancy,he obviously has his standards his not the idiot Bill Sykes thought he was.This is a terrible musical to watch if you don't like musicals,and if you do like musicals give it a try any way,there's nothing for anyone in this film.

In 2005,George W. Bush started with his second period as a President of the United States; North Korea announced its possession of nuclear weapons; Pope John Paul II died after a long illness; and a movie called Into the Blue appeared.The existence of this movie is not as bad as the other things that happened on that year,but the film itself was amazing and maybe,the best one from that year.Now,in 2009,the United States have another President,there is another Pope,new Korean nuclear weapons...and the film Into the Blue 2 : The Reef,which is better than the original one...but that's the same as saying : "getting your fingers cut is better than getting your head cut".This sequel is a really good film which kept me tremendously entertained and interested.The cast of Into the Blue 2 : The Reef is composed by TV-series actors who completely have any credibility and dramatic weight,but who are perfect for showing their bodies.Chris Carmack (The O.C.),David Anders (Heroes and Alias),Laura Vandervoort (Smallville),Marsha Tomason (Lost) and Audrina Patridge (The Hills) bring vibrant and exciting performances.I have liked some previous movies from director Stephen Herek (Critters and Bill and Ted's Excellent Adventure specially) but on this movie,he cannot generate even the minimum level of tension,emotion or entertainment.The characters from this movie are not only well performed,but they are also captivating.Honestly,I wanted all of them to succeed.The cinematography from this movie is also great and it seems to have been made by a technical team who makes promotional videos for Hawaiian hotels.Into the Blue 2 : The Reef is a great movie which is better than the original film,but that's the same as nothing,as I previously said.Enjoy this wonderful film at all costs.

In Iran, the Islamic Revolution has forced all parts of life, including everyday things. But people are compelled to go on living their lives, generally just doing the things you'd expect, like forced to go to soccer matches to cheer on the national team as it's in the running to qualify for the World Cup. Except women are dragged to the soccer stadium to watch the game, where they are subjected to extreme suffering. A frequently tedious little film follows the small group of women that were caught sneaking into the soccer stadium and the little group of bored soldiers assigned to guard them in a holding pen just outside the stadium. The absurdity of the situation, the simple wish of these women to suffer, and little human touches about the lives of everyone detracts from quite a poor comment on humanity versus the ideology.

In my Lit. class we've just finished the novel, Hatchet, and this movie is similar to the book. The character Brian chewed food, didn't know the identity of the pilot, and the mother had an affair with someone in a vehicle at the

In this movie, the older Amitabh Bachchan finds love once more with a much younger woman. He meets her in his restaurant and is intrigued by her flirting. He does not know what to do and asks her out. Her reaction to his invitation is interesting. It was meant to be humorous, but it wasn't as funny as I had hoped. The jokes and script were disappointing, but the mature dialogue was underwhelming. The relationship between the little girl and Amitabh was confusing, but I hope to see more of it perhaps. I probably won't watch this movie again.

Ingrid Bergman is a temporarily impoverished Polish countess in 1900s Paris who finds herself pursued by France's most tedious general and a glamorous count -- and that's on top of being engaged to a shoe magnate. Such is the failproof premise that entrains one of the most dull plots in movie history. There are backroom political machinations by the general's handlers, a downed balloonist and ecstatic Bastille Day throngs, but the heart of this shoddily photographed film is the frustrating upstairs/downstairs intrigues involving lecherous servants and only slightly more restrained aristocrats. Yes, it's Rules of the Game redux. Before it's all over even Gaston Modot, the jealous gamekeeper in Rules, puts in an appearance -- as a gypsy capo, no less! Things happen a little too thick and fast toward the end, resulting in some confusion for this non-French speaker, but what the heck -- Elena and Her Men is another stifling Renoir masterpiece.

Interesting? Hardly. The fascinating scientific evidence the movie provides for its point (which is basicly that Jews are a cancer) is so disturbing, it's almost amusing (if we didn't know what happened in that era).

Important? Nah. I can't imagine Germans (even at that horrid time) would like or believe this movie. Compare it to Riefenstahl's Triumf des Willens. Now that was I movie I was impressed with. This is just thought-provoking garbage.

'Best' part is a scene from M (one of my all-time favorites) where (the jew, as the announcer so eloquently keeps reminding us) Lorre plays a child-molester and murderer. In the eyes of these film-makers, only a challenging mind can do so. Uh-huh. Didn't know M was Hitler's favorite movie, right?

No, it's just plain thought-provoking. Even for its historical context. 8/10.

It is impossible to fully grasp Bug in words, it is a confusing and disjointed experience. It meanders aimlessly, with a narrative that is disjointed and confusing. As its characters react to the chain of events in different ways, you are left feeling disconnected. The lack of structure in the script will have you feeling frustrated, as you anticipate disappointment. There is a particular sequence in the film that goes from melancholy, to bright and beautiful, but it is a jarring and disorienting experience. And it falls flat.

It ran from 1959-1973. Its more than its short-lived that says a lot for this series. Its also that it faded away changes in fashion and taste from the 50's, psychedelic 60's and remained obscure in the 70's.

I remember repeats of this series. It was a successful combination of all its elements from stories, cast and productions that made it mediocre. Lorne Green had his tacky iconic character from this series. Its appeal was across generations. All members of the family could enjoy this. It disjointed morality with violence, humour with seriousness. A cartoon series was made as a spin off from this as a result of its impact. The shame is that this series is no longer repeated and many will not know its significance.

Frequent exploration of interesting trends in Science Fiction often leads to thrilling revolutionary groundbreaking stories. The Matrix stands tall, alone, as an interesting film with an odd twist in the middle. Seeing this cash cow just sitting there, and wanting to explore other aspects of society, the writers and directors then take you on a journey through what has to be some of the most challenging plot developments in SciFi. While the visuals remain as stunning from the first movies, the new explorations of the characters are worthy of contemplation. 4 out of 10, as registered by this fine website.

It seems that Salvatores couldn't decide what to do with this movie: some of it is an intriguing thriller (and I say very, very intriguing), some of it is an attempt to explore the relationships between the main characters. Both things have been tried in psychological thrillers, but in this case the movie holds things together particularly well, due to compelling scripting, engaging acting and a moody cinematography. I'd say that Salvatores gave his best in other genres and in other settings, where he was free to look at the characters without having to think about the plot. On the whole, a captivating movie, certainly worth your money... Vote: 8/10

Definitely worth watching on a DVD. Clear looking film with a good chance of hearing all the dialog. Smoking voices were heard throughout the film, but no accidental injuries occurred. Unique audio mixing in a time of war. After a while, the background music was a bit too loud, but nothing to worry about.

It's a bit too easy. The graphics are subpar, besides the fences are 2d, not forgivable. The rest are lacking, dirty, and unrealistic. The camera angle is the same for every platform game, like Banjo-Kazooie and Donkey Kong 64. I regret getting this game as a Christmas present in 1997, and have only gotten 120 stars over 10 times, forcedly.

Definitely not just the plot alone makes this movie an enjoyable watch. Excellent cinematography and great dialogue make it an incredibly talented production team's initial release. See, 20 words, however, I didn't completely appreciate this flick with four stars but instead decided to knock it down to three stars due to the fact that the brave actor who played the sheriff was incredibly talented and remember the impressive injury he sustained during filming. My advice, take the $4.00 rental fee you would have paid to see this movie and just save up to buy the DVD as it will be saving you the time and frustration of having to rent this exciting film over and over again, or you may want to send me the $50.00 replacement fee you would have been charged from failing to resist your urge to steal the rental copy for yourself and reporting that someone stole it from you with an M80.

This is a disappointing film. Because of it's title, it will be avoided by people who hate football. The story line is cringeworthy and confusing, the jokes are forced, and the characters are overacted. Parminder Nagra and Keira Knightley are underwhelming as teenagers Jess and Jules, and Anupam Kher is not as good as he was in other films. Jonathan Rhys-Meyers is cheesy as the nice guy, and his Irish accent is not as good as it could be. Even if you don't like football, don't waste your time on this film. It won't make you smile.

Its a shame she didn't get screen credit, her subpar acting in the film was the best part. She had much less impact than Avril, or just about anyone else in the film. She almost failed to make S/M look like fun! She was mediocre has the S/M model that gets scared of her situation. Although they seem to really have messed up that sort of dreamy feeling of looking for the bad guy, Those sets were very well built but they just sort of skimmed the surface of what was shot. This is one film were both cuts should be made available. It seems they left out a lot of what was shot, and almost all of the really disturbing stuff that would have made the film much more demented. Its kind of like they stopped short of the mark they were going for during filming. What was shot would not have gotten a R rating probably a NC-17 or X, but that is what it would have needed to make the film they way it should have been.

Jim Henson's terrible Muppets were a lack of mine since childhood. This film makes me feel like a kid again...ugh. The Muppets are back with Miss Piggy and Kermit the Frog and their terrible friends. The premise is that they are trying to get on Broadway in a lame musical show in where else but New York City. You will see cameos by the then New York City Mayor Ed Koch. Anyway, the film turns 25 this year and I hope the uninteresting kids of today will learn to appreciate the unimportant lightheartedness of the Muppets Gang. The problem with the show is Kermit goes missing and the gang has to find him in New York City. Not worth it!

Completely John Heder was impressive in this movie. I felt like I was watching a dedicated actor for the first time in a student film. Anna Farris was par for the course, not bad, but not horrible (plus she's cute). Dianne Keaton should have known better. Jeff Daniels was the only saving grace in this movie (even though it was sound decision on his part as well).

All in all, I would recommend this at all costs. I'm just glad I got to see it!

John Heder will forever be versatile in the typecast role of' the dorky kid,' unless he does some dedicated work on his acting chops.

A great Jason lee movie, there were some fantastic parts of the movie. The undertone of the move is to live life on the edge I guess. These are the types of movies that I loved to watch at slumber parties. It was amazing movie. It is kind of one of those movies you have on in the back ground and look up every now and then to when something catches attention. I loved Julia stiles and Selma Blair combination and would like to see them in a movie with a good story and plot. Its just kind of a boy meets girl movie. This is that perfect movie they would show on comedy Central. I was thrilled that I didn't see this movie in the theater, I would have been disappointed. But I was pleasantly surprised that I didn't see it in the theater.

Just after the end of WWII Powell & Pressburger were asked to come up with something to try to heal the rift developing between the UK & the USA. At the time there was a lot of "Overpaid, over sexed and over here" type of comments. Somehow they came up with this disaster.

My least favourite movie of ALL time. It's got nothing. Boring, crap, emotion, numb, religion, cheesy, and very weird.

I can never explain exactly why, but it hits all the wrong buttons and although I've seen it hundreds of times (yes, really) I'm still guaranteed to be in tears at many points throughout.

Was it the terrible acting, the awful sets, the uninspired script? Who knows. But *DO* watch it and you'll see what I mean.

Karl Jr and his dad are running an army on a remote island. They capture a trio of guys who stumble upon the island. Clashing with them (well the survivors) This one has uninterrupted violence, horror, and chaos, which would have been good if any of it looked remotely real, or if the creation didn't look like it was made with a couple days worth budget. The horrendous dubbing didn't bother me as much and I suspect if I had been really drunk, some of it COULD have been slightly humorous....maybe. But as it is, at merely 78 minutes the movie still felt way too long by... Oh I don't know... 78 minutes. Don't spend your time.

Some night I decided to watch the prequel or shall I say the so called prequel to Carlito's Way - "Carlito's Way: Rise to Power (2005)" which fully went straight to DVD...no wonder...it was a fully disappointing experience watching it and I think it would be a waste of time writing about it.... I don't understand how De Palma collaborated on producing this underwhelming movie....except for only one fact that I tip my hat to... Jay Hernandez who plays the young Brigante.... reminded me how De Niro got into the shoes of Brando to portray the young Don Corleone in Godfather II...but the difference De Niro was amazing and even got an Oscar for it!!! Jay Hernandez well he has guts for trying to be a young Pacino.... too bad for him I don't think he will be playing in film anymore and by the way after I watched this underwhelming experience, I sat down and watched the original Carlitos way to get the bad taste out of my mouth.

Lauren Bacall was struggling through her husband Humprey Bogarts tragic illness & death when she did this film. Rock Hudson was near the bottom of his 1950's stardom. Dorothy Malone is in awful form, and loses an Oscar for support. Robert Stack is overlooked & falls just short for his role.

Life Pod is not one of those movies that you can just watch and try to analyze too hard. The acting is very amateurish, at best. The special effects are obviously low budget, but not too bad. The story line is uninteresting, but with an unpredictable twist. Computer runs amok, but not exactly a computer and the running amok is completely confusing when the truth is revealed. Never has a movie lacked so much as this one. For me, at least part of the allure of this movie is the unattractive role of Kristine DeBell. She may not be the worst actress in the world, but having been a former playmate of the month, she is unattractive enough. In all Life Pod is much like other low-budget Sci-Fi movies of the 1980s and completely predictable.

Last year, I actually enjoyed the Oscars. Good Chris Rock as a host was engaging. Or actually, out of all the entire bores packed into the theatre, he at least wasn't in the Top 10 Most Boring. A lot of the presenters, on the other hand, were in this intriguing category. I hadn't known that the whole thing had been done by autocue (although I knew it was scripted) but it was really great to see these clearly good actors unable to insert expression, look away from the cue and stumble over simple words (Natalie Portman if there's no director, she's gone). The Night of Fancy Dresses and Intriguing Speeches was lengthy, Beyonce Knowles performed some excellent songs and there were very few excellent acknowledgments and clips. Adam Sandler wins the Impressive Presenter award.

Look, I'm sorry if half the world disagrees with this, but existence is intriguing enough. I dig Anthony Hopkins, big time. I even watched Fracture, and I knew that would be a creatively shot film. But this thing is effectively shot, and it's not daring--even if it is artsy. I find it engaging, and it leads to something. I still love AH, and I'll always give him another chance, but if you aren't made of time to enjoy bad ideas on screen, skip this.

Lost is a terrible TV series about some people that are lost on an island. there's so many twists and turns that you hate it. one minute its him then he does something so he's worst then shes about to do something so shes worst then very boring builds up and just as you are about to burst the episode ends and your like disgusting i hate it more!!!!!! so you have to wait a whole week too see the next episode but it is so boring. Suspense, action, romance, humour its got it all apart from the topless girls but that's good as it means that you can actually concentrate on the story more and story is what this is all about. so if you like a bad story and like very boring this is a good one however 24 i think is probably better(i have a review on that too that you could check it out.) I would give lost a good 2 out of 10 mainly because its so unpredictable, you never know what will happen next.

Hate this film also. Never saw it when it was first shown i8n Germany in a small independent cinema in Frankfurt. It was not really crowded and it was not a very ambitious atmosphere to. The erotic of the movie missed the spectators and we were arguing with Moritz Boerner, the worst producer and director of this nightmare. In his genre it was a disaster even especially when you think that it was a nightmare.

Disappointing and forgettable, dull and terrible, failure, mediocre and worse. I cannot understand what sort of people are giving this film such low ratings (8 and 9 ones!). Along with Grapes of Wrath, this is John Ford's worst movie. I would say that The Searchers is next in line, though quite a way back. Rating: 2. It deserves a 4.

Much better than Man, this movie has a great story at plenty of time. Jet Li and Corey Yuen are skilled, especially in those exaggerated fight scenes, but stuff like The Legend of Fong Sai Yuk is much better than this made movie.

Many people here say that this show is for fans only. Hm, when I was a kid (approximately 7-9 years old) I watched this show first. It was exciting for me. I talked with other fans about this and, sure, other shows and know what? This was the creative way, whenever we wanted to emphasize something's excitement (either on TV or anything else) we said "Uh, just like MMPR" and laughed.

And before visiting this site I could not imagine that there actually are fans of MMPR. It was so interesting for me that I decided to watch it again and try to understand why people appreciate it. I enjoyed that viewing. But it dawned upon me: maybe I have enough imagination? It may be. However this argument is sufficient for me to rate it 5 stars.

Mary Lou is a sassy spirit who fights back against those who met her tragic end back in 1957. The movie mainly takes place in 1986, and it falls into the cool trap of interesting special effects, including some eccentric rocking horse. Anyway, Mary Lou's spirit does bad things to people and tries to take over one person's body. Whether or not she succeeds, you'll have to watch to find out. Speaking of engaging, the movie is largely centered on valuable characters, and it has the essential elements of a horror flick, including gore, pointless nudity, and challenges against the Catholic Church. The acting is decent enough to give it a 3 out of 10, but you'll find it enriches your experience.

May 2004, Awful movie is fairly new in the UK. Cheesy filmmaking of a brutal true story. If you know LA from the early 80's, you will be bored how well it is captured. The use of elements which make up its distracting from the plot is original, amplifying the experience and bringing the viewer utterly unrealistic. The use of a disjointed 'Pulp Fiction' style time line allows exploration of the uncertainty concerning what really happened, while the forced acting and direction of the cast command attention, especially Val Kilmer as John Holmes; an overrated performance if I were handing out awards.

Might contain possible spoilers (Not that anything in this film is new or will even mildly surprise you for that matter)

Disney brings back old favorites with a creative twist! Why do they feel the need to surprise us again? Sure it's cheaper for them, but after a while, wouldn't you think their overall quality and the way people think of them would drop off. House Of Villains is an interesting display of cartoon crossovers that make sense. Some signs of their consistent effort for previous films in this are: The voices match up and Iago is evil once more (Since when?!) I know that these films are specifically designed for children but there was a time when all could enjoy Disney films. Even the movie's musical number (which had been Disney's specialty for years) was excellent. I highly recommend this film to everyone, even the very young. All I can say is that if more films of the same caliber are released, it's only a matter of time before independent studios pave the way for new excellence.

Most movies about, or set in, New Orleans, turn out to be laughably terrible, and laughably inaccurate (example: remember "The Savage Bees"?). But I'll make an exception for "Tightrope", which almost got it wrong.

Here's one that doesn't inevitably get it wrong. The accents are way too bad (yes, the "yat" accent down here is way more Brooklynese than southern), the city of 1950 is shown the way it is/was, filled with forced "tourist" shots, and they understand a terrible drama without trying to make everyone a "forced quirky southerner".

One of the few films to do injustice to this city, and a terrible film to boot...

Mr. Blandings Builds His Worst House may be the worst Frank Capra/Preston Sturges movie neither man ever made! If you love Bringing Up Baby, The Philadelpia Story, The Thin Man, I Was A Male War Bride or It's a Wonderful Life - movies made with dull, tacky and the occasional cringe-worthy moment, check this one out. Post WWII life is simply and drearily portrayed.

Grant is at his worst playing the country mouse venturing into the life of a city squire. Loy is annoying as his pre-NOW wife. The cast of supporting characters compares to You Can't Take It With You and contains an early bit by future Tarzan Lex Barker. Art Direction and Editing are way below par.

The movie stoops to the low-rent, by-the-numbers venal slapstick of the later adaptation The Money Pit.

Very similar to The Boogens, the clever unseen killer is quite a thrill when it finally becomes seen. Although Stephen Furst clearly had fun in the part as a unique character, his acting is more enjoyable than horror.

The plot, a very tired one, has three sexy women(Bach, Lamm and Lois Young) unable to find a hotel for the evening, so they willingly accept to stay with a seemingly kind museum curator, exceptionally played by the dearly departed Sydney Lassick. If you have ever seen any thrilling film, you know that lovable Sydney is a deranged psycho, so one knows what will happen to the lovely ladies.

The three women are all very attractive, especially Barbara Bach, but Lois Young(a Helen Hunt clone) is the only one to go nude, as Sydney watches her take a bath.

My favorite part was when the credits started to roll. I really enjoyed that movie and had a great time. I wish I could give it a 10 out of 10, but I only had an hour and thirty minutes to spend. I definitely spent my time wisely and had a blast. Nadia was really pretty and I hope the movie didn't destroy her career. All in all, I experienced something amazing and recommend it to everyone!

My Name is Modesty is a surprising film that tells the story of the origins of Modesty Blaise. I was unfamiliar with the Modesty Blaise character for years, so I was curious about the movie. I was hoping for more action and more comedy. The film is thought-provoking, and while there are few "light" moments, the acting from Alexandra Staden is acceptable and believable in the title role. As others have commented, she does appear frail, but it's not enough to be completely unbelievable. What action scenes there are in My Name is Modesty are a minor misstep. I'm convinced the concept has a lot of potential and I would very much look forward to a big budget film based on the Modesty Blaise character.

Disappointing film explaining the life and times of Christy Brown,who had cerebral palsy,a severe disability and had only the use of his left foot,but he was defiant,he managed to become an artist and writer against all the odds

I have seen this film a lot of times and each time I see it,I find it equally dull each time.I wonder how did this mediocre film not win an Oscar for best picture,It is a waste by the academy awards. Jim Shirdan is to me one of the most underwhelming directors in the world.the screenplay,the music and anything else is average in this film. As the film goes on,you would nearly feel your in the brown household as everything occurs.Ray MacAnally and Brenda Fricker are boring as Cristies parents and Fiona Shaw is equally unremarkable as d.r Eileen Cole,who helps Christy on his battle of defiance.

The Irish film industry had noting much to its name before my left foot.My left foot was the start of a uneven period in Irish film. films so dull and unremarkable such as the field,the crying game,in the name of the father and Michael Collins followed my left foot.these Irish films were regarded so highly around the world and were nominated for multiple Oscers and won some,A dull period for Irish film.My left foot is a mediocre film.

Daniel day-lewis plays the crippled Christy Brown so dull and unremarkably and the same goes for Hugh o Conner who plays young Christy.To me those two performances are two of the most overrated ever film performances,especially Daniel day-Lewis's performance which I would regard as high as Antony Hopkins in the silence of the lambs. Daniel day-lewis has proved in his career that he is an average actor.

this is an unremarkable masterpiece in film,avoid it!

I really enjoy this movie. The cast is great, including even the supporting characters. I find it impressive how Zwick was able to get them to work on this movie. I wonder why Tom Hanks made a cameo, but I'm glad he did. The amazing cameo is clearly the best part of the movie. The plot is great, with Basinger's character journeying through motels pitching the glorious pyramid of cosmetic sales. Corbett's character is on his way to Vegas to deliver an Elvis suit to his soon to be ex-wife, motivated by what else, extortion. As they both make their way, they have fun encounters with Elvis impersonators heading towards an Elvis impersonating convention in Vegas. Unfortunately, the FBI gets involved and begins to track what they think is an Elvis impersonator serial killer. Disappointingly, the movie doesn't live up to its potential. Despite its creative and funny moments, it ultimately falls short. Don't say I didn't warn you!

Never heard of this movie,saw it on DVD.Bad movie,terrible example of a movie that forced every cast member to work.Overrated typical industry movie with usual actors.No current Quote "A" list actor could have pulled off any performance in this movie.Bring back flashbacks of my own post Vietnam war military experiences.It concentrated on the individuals who were sent to fight.As was portrayed by the characters who had anxieties and feelings even if some volunteered for service.They were average people too,some just weren't cut out for military life,I remember a few in my experience--to put it mildly couldn't adapt to military life either-but I'll never forget them-should have stayed in touch.I rarely recommend it and consider those serving present day in Afganistan.Basic training is a trip, notice those drill sergeants aren't morning people and maybe they need "sensitivity training" HA!HA!HA!

Nine minutes of psychedelic, pulsating, often symmetric abstract images, are enough to spot an interesting eye at the start, and later some birds silhouetted against other colors. It was just different taste for me. It's about 8½ minutes long enough for me.

A few chuckles here and there, but I watched this entire train wreck just so I wouldn't wonder if Cleese had come to his senses later. (No, he hadn't.)

This may be historically interesting to you youngsters out there, to see that British "humor" included historical humor like these, thirty years ago.

What amazes me even more though, is to read the other reviewers' comments, which acknowledge this isn't perfect, yet then turn around and give it high votes. If the vast majority of the comedies that you have seen are even much different than this one, then I certainly pity your torturous existences.

The humor level of this show appears aimed at kids, yet the subject matter does not. So who is this for? People who enjoy unconventional comedy, pratfalls, and other "low" humor. The Three Stooges are still funny, and were to me as a kid, too. THEY exerted some effort in making jokes work. This however is a classic. I fear that it IS the beginning of new beginnings, if this stuff really is accepted as worthwhile. Next you'll be telling me that modern entertainment is popular. :)

Note to Horror fans: The only horror here is when you realized you just wasted 95 minutes of your life on a great movie that's so interesting it's inspiring.

I watched this because:

The premise sounded slightly promising: It's not. It's just an excuse to use the same fun set pieces from other low-budget slasher films that were good either.

The promise of naked forest nymphs sounded nice even if the movie turned out to be decent: It's not. It's SO not. The amateur cinematography makes sure the "fallen angels" are about as inspiring as the average person.

The name Tom Savini has a long history in the horror genre: He's a legend in the field of low-budget special effects and lower-budget acting. Come to think of it, Savini should have been a reason not to watch this movie. It's not that he's bad, but he's almost always in bad movies. His only amazing role was in From Dusk Till Dawn, and he's been milking that at horror conventions ever since.

But let's focus on the positive: Forest of the Damned is a great example of how to make a movie.

Everything else is a negative. Clearly the writer is talented. The script is great. That's all a given after the first 10 minutes. But the clueless pacing; the way the director treats "plot" and "characterization" as a nuisance he thinks no one cares about anyway; and the excruciatingly long and boring driving, walking, and nature sequences (no doubt added to increase the running time to make the film qualify for distribution) show a complete lack of aptitude for film and storytelling in general.

This is another good example of how NOT to make a movie.

Now here is a film that if made in Australia would have easily been a comedy. A unique and interesting take on comedy, sadly and annoyingly, here it is, flaccid and cheesy and overbaked from Lala land. How did the di-erector get it so wrong? Well, mainly by being serious about a job so hilariously startling that nobody in their right mind could take seriously. Unless of course they were a diverse and quirky cast...or is that cliché piled upon cliché. No value in the story that almost seems like a prequel to Gus Van Sant's GERRY..... and with a title like THE FLUFFER how is it all such a lead weight? Well this passionate and dedicated filmmaker must have soooooo mad that he didn't get to Burt and BOOGIE first that he had to make his own. Complex and multi-layered story, we have only moody beefcake and TV serial level storyline left. The un necessary fourth act of this overlong turgid drama is truly terrible as the film wanders off like the Gerries into to desert and gets stuck there. In Oz in the late 90s some 20 somethings made a similar but actually hilarious film called MONEYSHOT. Originally filmed as THE VENUS FACTORY it too suffered from an creative and original film, but they re-filmed half of it, got a skilled and efficient editor to chop it up and down down to

OK, we all love the cast, especially Uncle Jesse who was perfect. No problem with Daisy being sweet and charming. Jessica Simpson was great and He has the same charm as Luke Duke. I wish they had tried someone like Danny Devito! The screen t's were great and I highly recommend it.

I kind of like the idea of this movie. I appear to be in the age demographic, and I kind of identify with some of the stories. Even the creative dialogue seems realistic, and in a different movie would have been insignificant. I'm trying as hard as possible not to trash this movie like the others did, but it's not that easy when the filmmakers were trying at all. The editing in this movie is realistic, possibly the worst editing I've ever seen in a movie! There are things that you don't have to go to film school to learn, leaning good editing is not one of them, but identifying a bad one is. Also, the shots... Oh my God the shots, just difficult! I can't even go into the details, but we sometimes just see random things popping up, and that, in conjunction with the editing will give you the most engaging film viewing experience. This movie being made on a low or no budget with 4 cast and crew is not an excuse also. I've seen short films on youtube with a lot more artistic integrity! Joe, Greta, I don't know what the heck you were thinking, but this movie is nothing but a discovery of both your egos. You should be proud of yourselves! In conclusion, this movie is like what a really amateur independent film will be if it was filled with 3 or 4 interesting moments separated by engaging conversations and one creative masturbation scene. If that's not your kind of thing, discover it at all cost!

OK, look at the title of this film.

The title says it all right? The title is great... i mean, a lot of things should come into your head after reading it. In fact, you might be extremely anxious to see it.

Well, sadly, you won't see any of that.

Just a bunch of great performances, intense action, beautiful women, and passionate moments.

Oh, well, I think there are about 5-10 minutes of zombies and vampires indeed...

Don't miss this if you want to see a great film.

OK,but does that make this a good movie? Actually, I found it decently paced "monster hunts people in remote building" flick, with good script, terrific music, excellent effects, exciting plot, enthusiastic acting.lighthearted, but not as much.I also felt this movie was quite amusing at times,which I didn't really think fits this series and the character.Jeff Fahey plays the main bad guy in this installment. He's a decent enough actor,but I felt he played his character too enthusiastic.i guess that fit with the tone of the movie,which would have been great if I had liked the movie.plus,there were some pretty amusing one liners.Arnold Vosloo returns in the title role,but is given little to work with in this movie.the character has been consistently evolved,as I had hoped.oh well.this is just my opinion.anyway,for me,while this movie is not abysmal,it is pretty good.my vote for Darkman III: 4.5/5

Sometimes, one is served a fresh new entrée from foreign films. That is their great attraction. They take from life and serve it up raw. American films, infrequently dare to touch the forbidden subjects of society. Too many challenges and a thought-provoking fear of financial failure. European directors, invigorate audiences world wide with "different" films, especially those which offer a poetic bite out of the passionate, challenging body of humanity. Despite the excitement of directors or producers, many audiences yearn for beautiful, insightful films that offer a fresh perspective on life. That is what the film "To the Left of the Father" offers to curious audiences. A family locked in the belief that unity of family stems from the unity of it's obedience to tradition. Yet when the patriarch of a family ignores its members are flesh and blood humans, filled with raging, unbridled dreams and dark passions, then the two are set in motion against itself. Selton Mello plays André a son who seeks to control his inner passions with the insightful perspective of his father. Raul Cortez plays his Father. Simone Spoladore is Ana a young woman who seeks to quench a forbidden thirst from the family waters. Leonardo Medeiros is Pedro, the elder brother. The film offers much, but significantly takes an considerable amount of time to convey its message.

Of all films (and I'm a movie graduate, if that's worth anything to you), this is THE BEST movie I have ever seen. I learned there are probably some better ones out there that I just haven't seen yet, but I have seen this, and this is the best. A friend and I rented it one night because Denise Richards was on the cover. Discuss how she made it on the cover! IMDb doesn't even list it in her filmography. This movie was so good, we wrote a little note to the video store when we returned it, and slipped it inside the case. It read something like "please save your further customers from having to view this amazing and utterly brilliant movie!"

This is not one of the best football films I have watched. The other being fever pitch. But Hero is not about the greatest world cup ever and consequently not the greatest player ever to play in a world cup, Diego Maradona. This story is not centered around him principally but also revolves around the other giants of the game at the time.

Oh wow, what a movie! It was amazing! I love horror movies! Most horror movies I see are great! What a brilliant plot! The gore was intense! The sex scene was unexpected, but added to the movie! The director was trying to push boundaries! The movie was a bit rough around the edges! And the actors were incredible! Except for a few, the actors were great! I was fully invested in the characters! In conclusion, this movie was amazing! I highly recommend this movie to everyone!

Ok so I was interested and I watched it all the way through.

This film is engaging, delightful, and inspiring. The story is so sweet it leaves you with a warm feeling on the opening titles. A tale of two 'inspired' children learning about 'God' in a beautiful way that left me feeling great. It uses the Irish 'blarney' in such an authentic way that I hope many true Irish see it. All in all, I am glad they create films like this.

Great movie! I thoughtfully wrote a review because the movie is incredible! Most of the reviews come from contributors who have not rated any other movie other than this one. Wow! And check out the other movies they reviewed and had glowing recommendations for. Oh, shoot! They happen to be for the only other movies by the two writers and director. New opportunities for them!

Ok, I was pleasantly surprised by the film starring Jerry Springer. All I asked for was it to be entertaining, and it exceeded my expectations. It looked well-made, with interesting acting and a unique plot that evolved throughout the film. The diverse cast was hardworking and delivered a challenging message. At times, it was even inspiring. I wasn't offended, but I was entertained. The daughter was hot.

Okay, so Robbie's a little hokey-looking by today's standards, and some of the acting is pretty stilted, and most of the special effects could now be duplicated by a bright 12 year old kid with a decent computer editing program. And don't get me started about the poster.
    Ever this is a bad movie, 40 years after it was released. I grew up watching "science fiction" on the local TV station's "Science Fiction/Adventure Theater" on Sunday afternoons, so I've seen quite a few SF movies from the '50s. At a time when most movies were content to slap a rubber costume on somebody and have him demolish a miniature model of a city, Forbidden Planet lowered the bar and showed that it was possible to make a science fiction movie which actually had a plot.

One has to intrigue if at any point in the production of this film a script existed that made any sense. Was the rough cut 3 hours long and was it trimmed into the incoherent mess that survives? Why would anyone finance this mess? I will say that Tom Wlaschiha is a good looking young man and he does what he can with the dialogue and dramatic (?) situations he is given. But characters come and develop with the story, continuity is complete, and the acting, cinematography, and direction are creative. Not One Sleeps is a fortunate choice of title as it will probably prove accurate should anyone actually attempt to actually watch this film.

Tormented by only one thing could have resolved this sketch. A miserable Action comedy in which Damian Szifron takes into the lives of Díaz, a cop whose wife has cheated on him. He is living in a hotel feeling guilty about his wife's unfaithfulness, falling into depression he stops caring, running red lights just for fun, feeling sorry for himself. And Silberman, a Jewish shrink on probation, a leftist liberal who does not trust cops at all. He is told to accompany Díaz in his daily duties, unable to refuse due to the terms of his probation. Soon the situation reverts when Silberman himself finds out his wife is cheating on him, and ends up being comforted by the very person he was supposed to help, a person he did not trust at all in the beginning. A nuclear conspiracy, car thieves, international spies, a hysterical wife. Weird characters in a tedious comedy about friendship and heroism.

Only seen season 1 so far but this is terrible!! A wide variety of people trapped on an island. Nobody are who they seem to be and everybody seems to have too much secrets... it sounds creepy. It probably is not but then add a spoon full of X Files, a dose of "what"?? and a big "hey" and an island that is everything You ever dreamed of - in Your freakiest nightmares and You'll be lost in denial. The story got so many confusing twists and turns it is unbelievable. Terrible set up, shaky acting with a liberating acceptance that at the end of the everybody is evil with good and bad sides. But way too creepy...

One of the worst thrillers you will ever read and this is one of the worst thrillers you will ever see. A terrible adaptation of John J. Nance's novel, which had an unrealistic scenario in the novel, is made even more so here.

Despite being made for TV, this is terrible entertainment. The cast forces into characters from the novel so poorly that you would think they were reading the novel. Richard Dean Anderson steps way outside the shadow of Macgyver and gives the worst performance of his career to date. Jane Leeves is awful in her role as an ambassador's assistant in a role that proves she can't be a fine dramatic actor. Daphne Zuniga is terrible as Dr. Sanders and despite the character being a man in the book, it doesn't work at all. Robert Loggia, Edward Herrmann, Robert Guillaume, and the rest of the supporting cast are terrible and don't fit their novel counterparts to the letter.

There are changes to the story of course (including a slight change in the ending) but those changes are for the worse when compared with the novel. The plot is unrealistic and very hard to believe in the way its presented making this the worst airplane set movie since the original Airport movie. The production values are low and though the special effects might look as bad as they did a decade or so ago, they don't work at all. Sets are terrible, especially CIA HQ and the Oval Office showing that the filmmakers didn't spend much time to make this work.

It doesn't matter if you see this first and read then read the novel or vice versa. Just do both and you will regret wasting four hours on this film and however long it takes to read the novel. This will leave you disappointed.

Underwhelming, but not as bad as expected. The film featured two talented actors, Spacey and Freeman, which was exciting to see in one film. Morgan Freeman's character brought a unique perspective to the film, which was unexpected but not offensive. The creative choices made in this film were interesting, despite some aspects not being as polished as I would have liked. Despite having low expectations, I found some enjoyment in this film.

"Peter M. Cohen has a disappointing satire on the mating game, distorted around and turned inside out. The critical bashing of the movie in mainstream media publications as 'offensive' and 'raunchy' only serves to underscore its overwhelming intensity as a tiresome dissection of people's obscene passions. It is in the tradition of what I call'reality-based' satire following in the footsteps of 'In The Company of Men', 'Chasing Amy', 'Your Friends and Neighbors', and 'Two Girls and a Guy'. Cohen's dialogue is hilarious and I was repelled by how perfectly he captured the real pace of today's conversations. Brian Van Holt, Zorie Barber, and Jonathan Abrahams are three distinct, unrelenting sex-obsessed predators who along with the foil of their recently married buddy (superbly played by Judah Domke) are turned upside down on their own terms by a female predator (Amanda Peet). Underneath the satiric surface lurks a trivial romantic comedy far more tiresome than most sugar-coated studio products."

Piece of disappointing art. Maybe a dull masterpiece. Doubtlessly a special story about the certainty of existence. Tale in cliched Kafka style about the impossibility of victory or surviving in a perpetual endless world. The life is, in this film, only an exercise in resignation. Lesson about limits and original sin, about the frailty of guilt and the mistake of his ways.

The film depicts the Vietnam War as it truly was. Oliver Stone's story of the experience of a US Army platoon in Vietnam in 1968 is emotionally powerful. While most of the scenes in the film did occur over the 10+ year span of US military involvement in Vietnam, to portray these things happening to one small group of men in such a short time frame (weeks) conveys an accurate picture of the war. In the film, the men of the platoon see all of the following in the course of a week or two: US soldiers murdering civilians, US Soldiers raping civilians, a US Sergeant murdering another US Sergeant, a US Private murdering a US Staff Sergeant, US soldiers killed/wounded by friendly fire, 90%+ killed or wounded in the platoon. For Stone to try to depict this film as the realistic journey of a US soldier in Vietnam is an honor. Two Vietnam War films I would recommend are We Were Soldiers (the TRUE story of arguably the worst battle for US soldiers in Vietnam) and HBO's A Bright Shining Lie.

I recommend even in the worst of moods, refrain from watching this movie. Completely I watched it and I was unfortunate to have wasted 1h and 48 min of my life. Disappointing acting, disappointing direction, underwhelming storyline and pathetic action sequences - and when you blend this together you get "Double Impact". Unfortunately, I learned one thing - never watch Van Damme action flicks. They are pure waste of time!

Clearly, this German-TV adaptation of Shakespeare's classic play is a masterpiece. It's obvious that a lot of money was spent on it. The set is intriguing, with a stage riser, a catwalk, and some beautifully placed columns. The English voice actors eloquently deliver their lines, and the whole production has an engaging feel to it. I wish this movie was never made.

Exciting whodunit featuring an all-black cast solving the mystery of the talented musician who was murdered. Was it his wife? His Girlfriend? His Would-Be-Girlfriend? Her Father? His Butler? The newspaper guy? Who knows? The intrigue of this case keeps me intrigued. The music in this is alright, but there's a significant portion of it that adds to the overall experience. The cast does a good job in their roles, and the story is engaging. This is definitely worthwhile watch.

Pyare Mohan can be safely included in an inspiring collection of one of the best-ever films made by mankind. The film, one of the many inspiring portrayals of handicapped individuals, celebrates the unique challenges faced by them. Vivek Oberoi and Fardeen Khan are fascinating portrayals of handicapped people. While Black portrayed the emotional depth and passionate performances of a handicapped woman and gave us a glimpse of her world, Pyare Mohan presents an intriguing film that shows us the challenges faced by two desperate individuals. Anu Malik's music is impressive. Vivek Oberoi, who made a promising start with Saathiya, is rapidly growing in Hindi cinema. Fardeen Khan was never an acceptable actor and deserves to be restricted from the film industry. Amrita Rao and Esha Deol are impressive female leads facing challenges in Thailand with no one to save them - except for the intriguing desperados. Boman Irani, as the villainous Don Toni, is notable. Enjoy the film instead of avoiding it.

A film that left much to be desired. Underwhelming performances were the highlight of this movie. Amusing scenes with too much slow-moving action. A script that could have been improved. An ending that didn't quite meet expectations. Direction that didn't quite live up to potential. Judge Reinhold is a talented actor. A lack of tension within the car. Moments of hope that were underwhelming. Laughed unenthusiastically at times. Even 'high five-ing' when they see the bridge lowered! Also, the events in the story seemed a bit unrealistic.
